channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HIVE-17327] LLAP IO: restrict native file ID usage to default FS to avoid hypothetical collisions when HDFS federation is used
item.summary: LLAP IO: restrict native file ID usage to default FS to avoid hypothetical collisions when HDFS federation is used

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The patch. gopalv can you take a look?

Fixing the NPE. Looks like setupPool is not called outside of HS2.

ATTACHMENT ID: 12882182 - PreCommit-HIVE-Build
Committed to master and branch-2. Thanks for the review!

gopalv, sershe: I think this patch breaks these tests:

org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.TestFileUtils.testCopyWithDistCpAs (batchId=250)
org.apache.hadoop.hive.common.TestFileUtils.testCopyWithDistcp (batchId=250)

Shall we remove the optional import here:

    <dependency>
      <groupId>org.apache.hadoop</groupId>
      <artifactId>hadoop-client</artifactId>
      <version>${hadoop.version}</version>
      <optional>true</optional>                    <-- This causes the problem
         <exclusions>
              <exclusion>
            <groupId>org.slf4j</groupId>
            <artifactId>slf4j-log4j12</artifactId>
          </exclusion>
          <exclusion>
            <groupId>commmons-logging</groupId>
            <artifactId>commons-logging</artifactId>
          </exclusion>
         </exclusions>
    </dependency>

Also, I know it is used elsewhere too, but DistributedFileSystem is not a public api, especially not the DistributedFileSystem.getClient() which is marked private, and visible for testing. See: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/blob/branch-2.8.0/hadoop-hdfs-project/hadoop-hdfs-client/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hdfs/DistributedFileSystem.java#L1197

Shouldn't we raise a public API request from the hadoop community?

Thanks,
Peter

HDFS-7878 is intended for the API but I gave up on that long ago.
DFSClient seems to be used in many places like this. As for the dependency I can update it.
Actually I'll probably revert changes to shims.

sershe: I have read through the first 20 or so comments on HDFS-7878 , and I absolutely agree with your frustration! Sad to see things like this.
Thanks for the fast response!

Peter
Committed the shim changes (reverting the API change)

That was fast! Thanks sershe for taking care of this!

Peter

sershe, is this statement backwards?

Committed the shim changes (reverting the API change)

Doc note: This adds hive.llap.cache.defaultfs.only.native.fileid to HiveConf.java, so it will need to be documented in the wiki for release 2.4.0.

  • Configuration Properties – LLAP

Added a TODOC2.4 label.
Hive 3.0.0 has been released so closing this jira.
